page.title: 11WORSHIP AT CROPWELL BUTLER
page.content: {The Methodist Church}was built in 1822 & extended in 1903. It will now hold a hundred people. The Anglican Chapel-of-Ease in the village closed and its font and 2 carved chairs and Church ornaments were removed to our Church, so that Anglican members felt at home there. We have an enthusiastic Organist, so enjoy some good singing. Members help with the cleaning and flower arrangements for the Communion Table. We have two members who are interested in workwork & building, so a keen eye is kept on the upkeep of the Chapel. Each month we have a Fellowship Meeting instead of a service, arranged by members who pick their own favourite hymns. It is followed by tea & biscuits. This is a change and it is working well.
